decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying constant pressure through efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Force of Will, the deck aims to control the game and prevent the opponent from executing their strategy. At the same time, aggressive creatures like Nethergoyf and Murktide Regent along with removal spells like Fatal Push allow the deck to close out the game quickly. This Dimir Tempo deck looks to tempo out opponents by combining disruption with a fast clock.

This deck focuses on maintaining control of the board by disrupting your opponent's strategies with counterspells and hand disruption while applying pressure with efficient creatures and removal spells. The goal is to carefully manage your resources and make calculated decisions to outmaneuver your opponent and secure victory through tempo plays and overwhelming pressure. The key to success lies in utilizing the synergy between your disruptive spells and threats to keep your opponent on the back foot and secure a dominant position on the battlefield.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to aggressively control the board with inefficient spells while utilizing cheap and efficient creatures to deal damage quickly. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Stifle, Daze, and Wasteland, while deploying threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent to quickly close out the game. The deck also includes a mix of cantrips and removal spells to maintain card advantage and deal with opposing threats effectively. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble allows for additional card selection and graveyard synergy with cards like Unholy Heat.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, aggressive strategy using small but powerful white creatures. By playing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Coppercoat Vanguard, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up a strong board presence. Cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant help to boost the power of the weenies, while utility lands like Ancient Tomb and Karakas provide additional support. With a focus on synergy and efficiency, this deck aims to win quickly and decisively.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly lock down the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon, while deploying powerful threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf to pressure the opponent. The deck aims to quickly close out the game by ramping into high-impact cards like Sundering Eruption and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, utilizing cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to accelerate its game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and Urza's Saga helps disrupt the opponent's game plan and further solidify the deck's aggression.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game by countering and removing threats, while also utilizing card advantage and card selection to stay ahead of the opponent. It focuses on disruption and removal with cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Prismatic Ending, while also using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate advantage. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and eventually win the game through incremental advantages and efficient spells.

This Legacy Combo - Show and Tell deck focuses on cheating big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play using Show and Tell and Omniscience. The deck aims to set up the combo quickly using cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder, while also protecting the combo with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. It also includes cards like Veil of Summer for protection against disruption. Additionally, the deck includes Cunning Wish for additional versatility and disruption options. The deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively by overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Dark Ritual, then bringing them back into play with cards like Reanimate and Exhume. It also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize, Cabal Therapy, and Collective Brutality to control the opponent's hand and board state. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast mana generation and powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Valgavoth, Terror Eater, while also utilizing cards like Dauthi Voidwalker and Opposition Agent to disrupt their strategies.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly get powerful creatures into the graveyard using cards like Entomb, Thoughtseize, and Brainstorm, and then bring them back onto the battlefield with cards like Animate Dead and Reanimate. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect the combo and control the game. The creatures in this deck, such as Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent, are strong threats that can quickly close out the game once they hit the battlefield. Overall, the deck aims to leverage its graveyard synergy and powerful creatures to win the game efficiently.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond, while disrupting the opponent's hand with Duress and Thoughtseize. It aims to assemble the necessary pieces for a powerful storm combo, using cards like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish to find key spells like Ad Nauseam or Tendrils of Agony. The deck also utilizes cards like Cabal Therapy and Cabal Ritual for additional disruption and mana generation. Overall, the deck aims to quickly build up a storm count and win the game in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on using graveyard recursion and powerful creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Reanimate, Entomb, and Animate Dead, the player can bring back high-cost creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game. The deck also includes control elements like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With efficient card draw from Ponder, Brainstorm, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, this deck aims to consistently execute its reanimation strategy and close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back to the battlefield for a powerful attack. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the game and protect its combo pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty while using counter magic and card draw to stay ahead in the game.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to generate mana and combo off using Mystic Forge. The key strategy is to assemble the pieces needed to generate infinite mana, then utilize Mystic Forge to play through the entire deck and find a win condition. The deck also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain to control the board and protect the combo. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can disrupt the plan.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then reanimating them onto the battlefield with cards like Animate Dead and Reanimate. It also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo, as well as cards like Stifle and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's gameplay. Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty are key creatures that can quickly swing the game in your favor once they hit the battlefield.

The main concept of this deck is to limit the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan by using cards like Magus of the Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Blood Moon to lock down their lands. It utilizes fast mana from cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to power out threats like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers quickly, putting pressure on the opponent. The deck also has a strong finisher in Sundering Eruption and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to close out games. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disruptive elements.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly with artifact cards such as Basalt Monolith and Grim Monolith, then use Mystic Forge to cast cards from the top of the library for free. Utilizing cards like Ugin, Tezzeret, and Karn, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck includes powerful artifacts like The One Ring and Chalice of the Void to further support its combo strategy. The key is to assemble the right combination of artifacts and control elements to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.
